Originally played this on the good ol' Xbox and i've loved it ever since.

This is my favorite Half Life simply due to,  Well, Gordon Freeman! And about time, too. Ah, Gordon Freeman. Freeman, ammo! Take some ammo! You're talking to yourself again. I can't remember the last time I had, well, anything. Cover me while I reload! CPs! Get the hell out of here! If you dare say 'That's gotta hurt,' I'll kill you. Wait a second... that's not Gordon Freeman! Got one! Gunship! Here, take this medkit. Hello, Dr. Freeman. Help!  Here come the hacks! I've got my little corner and I'm sticking to it. My arm! My leg! If I ever get my hands on Dr. Breen... Reload, Dr. Freeman! Ready when you are! Sorry, Doc. Hey, everybody, follow Freeman! When this is all over, I'm gonna mate. Do you feel it? I feel it! This way, gang.
Quite possibly one of the best games ever made. Excellent story and excellent gameplay that demands thought and quick wits.

As much as I loathe some chapters, I can't help but come back because of the sections that deliver an immersive and incredibly fun time. Although, I think the clear strength lies in the character performances and writing carrying the repetitive design on its back. It's also a little irritating having the tease of this dystopian world and how little of it is explored along the linear narrative.

The game always finds ways to keep the game unrepetitive and interesting. The first game was good, but the gameplay could be monotonous. This one feels compelling and interesting the entire way through.

Probably the best FPS storyline. Very unique. Still waiting for HL3. 
Still waiting...

I don't know why this game gets such high praise. The story is lackluster, the pacing feels weird, and the gameplay is standard at best. It may have been a banger when it originally came out but it isn't a game that is necessarily fun to play in the modern day.

in my honest opinion, I liked the first one more than the second in terms of gameplay. characters were average and Alyx was more annoying than likable for me. it had fun fighting scenes but it got stale halfway though the game. I enjoyed more watching videos about the universe and lore and stuff than playing this game. it still worth playing to find out about Half Life but it is no masterpiece to me
Really great. After one playthrough, I'd probably say this is a fair bit better than the first game. If you liked the first game at all, you'll love this.

Half-Life 2, simplemente una joya en Steam

10/10

Gordon Freeman. Crowbar. Lambda. Large explorable seamless worlds. Adventure-based first person shooter games. Garry's Mod. The Combine. The Citadel. Headcrabs. Alyx Vance. Source Engine. Does any of that sound familiar to you? This game has a massive influence on gaming as a whole, and you need to play this game if you haven't already.
